source: Integrated Maternal and Perinatal Care Guideline_23_10_2024_0
text:
dizziness, tachycardia, shortness of breath at rest). 
If not symptomatic, refer to the next high-risk clinic within one week. 
Hb 8.0 to 9.9 g/dL Transfer to a high-risk clinic if no improvement after one month of treatment. 
Hb <10 g/dL at 36 weeks gestation or more Transfer to hospital for further antenatal care and delivery. 
Management of mild anaemia (haemoglobin 8-9.9 g/dL) 
• Ferrous sulfate compound BPC, oral (dried), 170 mg (± 55 mg elemental iron) 12 hourly OR Ferrous fumarate,
oral,
